strings.Value: "Harrim? I saw Nyrissa trying to trick you into dying, by pretending to be the voice of Groetus..."
"We have to go. Are you ready to move?"
{n}Harrim meets you, stroking his beard pensively, and nods calmly as ever, like there's nothing amiss.{/n}

"It's true. I am sad to see that I almost gave in, taking her false words for the voice of {g|Groetus}Groetus{/g}. I almost felt the cold breath of the {g|Boneyard}Boneyard{/g}, but... memories returned to me of the feats we accomplished together. I remembered the lesson you helped me learn."

"Thanks to you, I felt the great power of chaos and destruction bestowed to me by {g|Groetus}Groetus{/g}. And I realized the god does not need to take me now. There is a place for me in the world you are building."

"Would {g|Groetus}Groetus{/g} reveal to me the true essence of the circle of making and unmaking, only to drive me from the world? I realized I had given in to a lie meant to take me from my path, and prevent me from helping you confront our old enemy. Then I shook off the deadly torpor and awoke."
